words.meaning: A Java programming language keyword used in a class definition to specify that a class is not to be instantiated, but rather inherited by other classes. An abstract class can have abstract methods that are not implemented in the abstract class, but in subclasses.
A program written in the Java programming language to run within a web browser compatible with the Java platform.
A data item specified in a method call. An argument can be a literal value, a variable, or an expression.
A collection of data items, all of the same type, in which each item's position is uniquely designated by an integer.
An operator that has two arguments.
The smallest unit of information in a computer, with a value of either 0 or 1.
In the Java programming language, any code between matching braces.
Refers to an expression or variable that can have only a true or false value.
A Java programming language keyword used to resume program execution at the statement immediately following the current statement.
A sequence of eight bits.
Machine-independent code generated by the Java compiler and executed by the Java interpreter.
A Java programming language keyword that defines a group of statements to begin executing if a value specified matches the value defined by a preceding "switch" keyword.
Explicit conversion from one data type to another.
A Java programming language keyword used to declare a block of statements to be executed in the event that a Java exception, or run time error, occurs in a preceding "try" block.
A Java programming language keyword used to declare a variable of type character.
In the Java programming language, a type that defines the implementation of a particular kind of object.
A method that is invoked without reference to a particular object.
A data item associated with a particular class as a whole--not with particular instances of the class.
In a program, explanatory text that is ignored by the compiler.
A program to translate source code into code to be executed by a computer.
The process of superimposing one image on another to create a single image.
A pseudo-method that creates an object.
A Java programming language keyword optionally used after all "case" conditions in a "switch" statement.
A Java programming language keyword used to declare a loop that will iterate a block of statements.
A Java programming language keyword used to define a variable of type double.
A Java programming language keyword used to execute a block of statements in the case that the test condition with the "if" keyword evaluates to false.
The localization of knowledge within a module.
An event during program execution that prevents the program from continuing normally; generally, an error.
A block of code that reacts to a specific type of exception.
An application that runs from within an HTML file.
Class X extends class Y to add functionality.
A data member of a class.
A Java programming language keyword. You define an entity once and cannot change it.
A Java programming language keyword that executes a block of statements regardless of whether a Java Exception, or run time error, occurred in a block defined previously by the "try" keyword.
A Java programming language keyword used to define a floating-point number variable.
A Java programming language keyword used to declare a loop that reiterates statements.
Graphical User Interface.
The numbering system that uses 16 as its base.
The name of an item in a program.
A Java programming language keyword used to conduct a conditional test.
A Java programming language keyword optionally included in the class declaration to specify any interfaces that are implemented by the current class.
A Java programming language keyword used at the beginning of a source file.
The concept of classes automatically containing the variables and methods defined in their supertypes.
An object of a particular class.
A Java programming language keyword used to define a variable of type integer.
Sun's trademark for a set of technologies for creating and safely running software programs.
The basic representation of any integer, floating point, or character value.
A Java programming language keyword used to define a variable of type long.
A function defined in a class.
Describes a program that is designed to have parts of its code execute concurrently.
A Java programming language keyword used to specify an undefined value for reference variables.
The principal building blocks of object-oriented programs.
The numbering system using 8 as its base.
Using one identifier to refer to multiple items in the same scope.
Providing a different implementation of a method in a subclass of the class that originally defined the method.
A group of types.
In networking, any functional unit in the same layer as another entity.
A Java programming language keyword used in a method or variable declaration.
A virtual address space containing one or more threads.
A Java programming language keyword used in a method or variable declaration.
A Java programming language keyword used in a method or variable declaration.
A Java programming language keyword used to finish the execution of a method.
A server-side program that gives Java technology-enabled servers additional functionality.
A Java programming language keyword used to define a variable as a class variable.
An array that is inside another array.
A class that is derived from a particular class.
A class from which a particular class is derived.
A Java programming language keyword used to access members of a class inherited by the class in which it appears.
The supertypes of a type are all the interfaces and classes that are extended or implemented by that type.
A Java programming language keyword used to evaluate a variable.
A keyword in the Java programming language that, when applied to a method or code block.
A Java programming language keyword that can be used to represent an instance of the class in which it appears.
The basic unit of program execution.
Keyword that allows the user to throw an exception.
Used in method declarations.
Defines a block of statements.
A class or interface.
An item of data named by an identifier.
Used in method declarations.
Used in variable declarations.
Used to declare a loop.
